rComments: Scott is an awesome guy who really does love math, but he understands how most students really don't. He'll be generous with his deadlines for homework and doesn't grade too harshly. He can be a little vague when explaining certain topics so it helped that I had taken AP Calc in high school. Either way, I liked the guy. Thanks, Scott!

This guy is one of the best math teachers I've had in college. More than anything, it's the fact that his lectures were interesting that kept me going in math 23B. His use of many resources to create the lectures is hugely beneficial. The tests were tough, but passable.

I took math 23B (multivariable calc) with Scott, and he was great. He was very enthusiastic in his lectures, and was very helpful when I had questions. Scott also didn't teach straight from the book; he used a whole library of Multivariable Calculus texts to build his lectures.

He is a fine teacher, and really tries to help his students, but I must say that his lectures were irrelevant. They were almost word for word from the book. He also lectured using a lot of math jargon. However, he grades easy so it kinda makes up for the lectures.
